comments.body: what prevents this from growing forever?

Nothing. The map will track all the unique PDs seen by the kubelet during its runtime. However, I don't foresee this as being an issue unless someone is attaching/detaching millions of unique PDs (over the course of a a kubelet lifetime, which I'd guess is about a month for machine due to reboots required for patching), at which point they are likely to run in to GCE quota issues first.

FWIW, another time we decided that resource garbage collection wasn't important, it ended up biting us due to causing kubelet CPU usage to increase by 10% a day.

And if we make multiple such leak-100-bytes-per-pod-attempt decisions in various places, it'll become unworkable pretty quickly.

Is there a not-too-unreasonable fix for the leak?  File an issue or at least document the known-leaking behavior in comments?
